availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Jesse McKenzie (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of James McKenzie and Frances McKenzie. Married to Nancy J. Rice McKenzie in Johnson County on March 4, 1852. Father of Samuel McKenzie, Mary E. McKenzie, G. N. McKenzie, John T. McKenzie, William W. McKenzie, and Elsie M. McKenzie. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 98A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, pp. 252-53.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, Enumeration District: 043, p. 139D.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, 1843-1875, Film #001912950, p. 128 of 239 of microfilm.
